janesabha： janesabha（pu）
ဇနေသဘ（ပု）
[jana+vasabha¿]
[ဇန+ဝသဘ¿]

Janesabha：A Gandhabba，a vassal of theFour Regent Gods．

He was present at the preaching of the Mahā-Samaya （D．ii．258）．

In the ātānātiya Sutta （D．iii．204） he is mentioned as a Yakkha chieftain to be invoked by the Buddha’s followers in time of need．

He is probably identical with Janavasabha．

janesabha：ဇနေသဘ （ပု）
[ဇန+ဝသဘ¿]
ဇနဝသဘနတ်သား။
